meanings.definition: Omitted or suppressed in speech or writing.
meanings.sent1: The elided details were crucial to the story.
meanings.sent2: The elided words made the paragraph shorter.
meanings.sent3: The elided joke left everyone wondering.
meanings.sent4: Her elided emotions bubbled under the surface.
meanings.sent5: The elided character added mystery to the plot.

meanings.sent1: She elided the unnecessary information from the report.
meanings.sent2: The editor elided the extra scenes from the movie.
meanings.sent3: He elided the vegetables from his sandwich, much to his friend's amusement.
meanings.sent4: The artist elided the background to focus on the main subject.
meanings.sent5: The teacher elided the difficult questions from the quiz to make it easier for the students.
